message: The answers that are generated by the model are not relevant to the questions.
The answer relevance metric threshold could be set to a very high value.

If the answer relevance threshold is set to a higher value, it can be identified by analyzing the question and answer values of the violated transactions and determining if the answers are not relevant. You can find the new threshold value through and change the value in your configuration settings.
The answers that are generated by the model are relevant to the questions.
The answer relevance metric threshold could be set to a very low value.

If the answer relevance metric threshold is set to a lower value, it can be identified by analyzing the question and answer values of the transactions with high metric values and determining if the answers are relevant. You can find the new threshold value and change the value in your configuration settings.
The contexts that are retrieved from the retrieval system are not relevant to the questions.
The contexts that are retrieved are not relevant due to issues with the retrieval system.
The context relevance metric threshold could be set to a very high value.

If the context relevance is low due to problems with the retrieval system, it can be detected by examining the context and question values of the violated transactions and determining if the contexts are irrelevant. The retrieval system issues could arise from the document corpus lacking the relevant information or the search process failing to retrieve the appropriate data due to issues in the model embeddings or chunking mechanism. Adjusting the model embedding or chunking parameters may help resolve these problems.

If the context relevance metric threshold is set to a higher value, it can be identified by analyzing the context and question values of the violated transactions and determining if the contexts are not relevant. You can find the new threshold value and change the value in your configuration settings.
The contexts that are retrieved from the retrieval system are relevant to the questions.
The context relevance metric threshold could be set to a very low value.

If the context relevance metric threshold is set to a lower value, it can be identified by analyzing the context and question values of the transactions with high metric values and determining if the contexts are relevant. You can find the new threshold value and change the value in your configuration settings.
The answers that are generated by the model are not faithful or grounded to the provided contexts.
The model doesn't use the information that's specified in the provided context to generate the answer and uses its own training data knowledge.
The faithfulness metric threshold could be set to a very high value.

If the model did not use the context information, it can be identified by analyzing the context and answer values of the violated transactions and determining if the answers are not faithful. You can update the model prompt with additional instructions to ground the answer based on the context only. If the violations exist after you update the prompt instructions, try using a different model.

If the faithfulness threshold is set to a higher value, it can be identified by analyzing the context and answer values of the violated transactions and determining if the answers are not faithful. You can find the new threshold value and change the value in your configuration settings.
The answers that are generated by the model are faithful or grounded to the provided contexts.
The faithfulness metric threshold could be set to a very low value.

If the faithfulness metric threshold is set to a lower value, it can be identified by analyzing the context and answer values of the transactions with high metric values and determining if the answers are faithful. You can find the new threshold value and change the value in your configuration settings.
The model did not answer the question based on relevant information in the context, but it uses information that is not relevant to the question.

If the model uses context information that is not relevant to the question, you can identify the irrelevant context information by analyzing the context and answer values of the violated transactions. The information could be irrelevant because the context contained irrelevant data which can happen due to retrieval of more chunks or due to large chunk sizes. If the issue exists after you fix the provided contexts, try using a different model.
The model is unable to answer the questions with the provided context.
The model could be unable to answer due to issues with the retrieval system or the model.
Please analyse the unsuccessful requests transactions along with the Retrieval and Answer quality metrics to understand your results better.
The number of relevant contexts compared to the total contexts retrieved from the retrieval system is lower.
The threshold values for retrieval precision or context relevance metrics could be set to a very high value.
The total number of contexts retrieved from the retrieval system could be higher.

If the threshold values for retrieval precision or context relevance metrics are set to a higher value, it can be detected by examining the context and question values of the violated transactions and determining if the contexts are  irrelevant. You can find the new threshold values for context relevance, retrieval precision and change the value in your configuration settings.

If the retrieval precision is low due to retrieval of too many contexts from the retrieval system, it can be detected by checking the number of irrelevant contexts in the violated transactions. The retrieval precision can be improved by reducing the number of total contexts retrieved from the retrieval system.
The number of relevant contexts among the total contexts retrieved from the retrieval system is higher.
The threshold for retrieval precision or context relevance metrics could be set to a very low value.

If the threshold for retrieval precision or context relevance metrics is set to a lower value, it can be detected by examining the context and question values of the transactions with high metric values and determining if the contexts are relevant and the retrieval precision threshold is suitable. You can find the new threshold values for context relevance, retrieval precision and change the value in your configuration settings.
The relevant contexts retrieved from the retrieval system are not ranked higher.
The thresholds for the average precision or context relevance metrics could be set to a very high value.
The relevant contexts that are retrieved are not ranked higher due to issues with the retrieval system.

If the thresholds for average precision or context relevance metrics are set to a higher value, it can be detected by examining the context and question values of the violated transactions and determining if the contexts are relevant and ranked higher. You can find the new threshold values for context relevance and average precision and change the value in your configuration settings.

If the relevant contexts are not ranked higher, it can be identified by analyzing the context and question values of the violated transactions and determining if the relevant contexts are ranked higher. Issues with the retrieval system could include the retrieval search failing to return the relevant data due to issues with model embedding or the chunking mechanism. Try changing the model embedding or chunking parameters to resolve issues.
The relevant contexts retrieved from the retrieval system are ranked higher.
The average precision or context relevance metrics threshold could be set to a very low value.

If the thresholds for the average precision metric or context relevance metric are set to a lower value, it can be detected by examining the context and question values of the transactions with high metric values and determining if the relevant contexts are not ranked higher. You can find the new threshold values for context relevance and average precision and change the value in your configuration settings.
The first relevant context is not returned at the highest position by the retrieval system.
The reciprocal rank metric threshold could be set to a very high value.

If the reciprocal rank metric threshold is set to a higher value, it can be identified by analyzing the context and question values of the violated transactions and determining if the first relevant context is at the first position. You can find the new threshold values for context relevance and reciprocal rank and change the value in your configuration settings.
The first relevant context is returned at the highest position by the retrieval system.
The reciprocal rank metric threshold could be set to a very low value.

If the reciprocal rank metric threshold is set to a lower value, it can be identified by analyzing the context and question values of the violated transactions and determining if the first relevant context is at the first position. You can find the new threshold values for context relevance and reciprocal rank and change the value in your configuration settings.
There is no relevant context in the contexts retrieved from the retrieval system.
The hit rate or context relevance metrics threshold could be set to a very high value.

If the hit rate or context relevance metrics threshold are set to a higher value, it can be identified by analyzing the context and question values of the violated transactions and determining if the contexts are not relevant. You can find the new threshold values for context relevance, hit rate and change the value in your configuration settings.
There is atleast one relevant context in the contexts retrieved from the retrieval system.
The hit rate or context relevance metrics threshold could be set to a very low value.

If the hit rate or context relevance metrics threshold are set to a lower value, it can be identified by analyzing the context and question values of the transactions with high metric values and determining if the contexts are relevant. You can find the new threshold values for context relevance, hit rate and change the value in your configuration settings.
The contexts retrieved from the retrieval system are not ranked in the descending order of relevance.
The relevant contexts that are retrieved are not ranked in the descending order of relevance due to issues with the retrieval system.

If the relevant contexts are not ranked correctly, it can be identified by analyzing the context and question values of the violated transactions and determining if the contexts are not returned in decending order of relevance scores. Issues with the retrieval system could include the retrieval search failing to return the relevant data due to issues with model embedding or the chunking mechanism. Try changing the model embedding or chunking parameters to resolve issues.
The contexts retrieved from the retrieval system are ranked in the decending order of relevance.
The normalized discounted cumulative gain metric threshold could be set to a very low value.

If the ndcg metric threshold is set to a lower value, it can be identified by analyzing the context and question values of the transactions with high metric values and determining if the contexts are returned in the decending order of relevance scores. You can find the new threshold value for context relevance and ndcg and change the value in your configuration settings.
